text_logic_form: The line $AB$ is tangent to the circle centered at $D$.
The line $CB$ is also tangent to the circle centered at $D$.
dissolved_text_logic_form: The line $AB$ is tangent to the circle centered at $D$.
The line $CB$ is also tangent to the circle centered at $D$.
diagram_logic_form: The length of the line $AB$ is $x + 15$ units.
The length of the line $BC$ is $2x - 5$ units.
Point $B$ lies on the circle centered at $D$.
Point $C$ also lies on the circle centered at $D$.
Point $A$ lies on the circle centered at $D$ as well.
line_instances: There are lines $AB$ and $BC$, forming a triangle with the line $AC$.
circle_instances: There is a circle centered at point D.
